meanings.definition: Prevented from asserting a claim or right
meanings.sent1: The estopped man could not argue his case in court.
meanings.sent2: She felt estopped from speaking up due to fear of consequences.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked estopped from reaching the treat on the high shelf.
meanings.sent4: The locked gate estopped the trespassers from entering the property.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rain estopped the hikers from continuing their journey.

meanings.definition: Barred or stopped from denying a fact or truth
meanings.sent1: The estopped witness could not change his statement.
meanings.sent2: The signed contract left him estopped from claiming ignorance.
meanings.sent3: The broken bridge estopped the cars from crossing the river.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise estopped her from hearing the phone ring.
meanings.sent5: The closed door estopped the dog from entering the room.
